description: Probably related to snaffle, which may be from Dutch snavel.

verbs.description: snavel (third-person singular simple present snavels, present participle snavelling, simple past and past participle snavelled)

examples: Then he missed his silk handkerchief. “Ghost!” he said, breathing heavily. “Mag′s snavelled it! […] ”
Paul tried to snavel Dan′s chair from under him.
